component.name: LOOT
component.summary: Modding utility for Starfield and some Elder Scrolls and Fallout games

description.p: LOOT is a plugin load order optimiser for:

ul.li: Starfield
The Elder Scrolls III: Morrowind
The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Special Edition (and Anniversary Edition)
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim VR
Fallout 3
Fallout: New Vegas
Fallout 4
Fallout 4 VR
Nehrim: At Fate's Edge
Enderal: Forgotten Stories
Enderal: Forgotten Stories (Special Edition)

description.p: LOOT can automatically calculate a load order that satisfies all plugin dependencies and maximises each plugin's impact on your game. It can also detect many issues, and provides a large number of plugin-specific usage notes, warnings and Bash Tag suggestions for Wrye Bash.

While LOOT can correctly handle the vast majority of plugins without help, some plugins need additional metadata to be sorted correctly. LOOT has a masterlist of metadata for each supported game, and you can add more to customise LOOT's behaviour.

screenshot.caption: The LOOT main window with plugin metadata open

ul.li: Fixed an "Ambiguous load order detected" warning being shown following Starfield's August update.
Other fixes and improvements.
Re-enabled sorting for Starfield.
Added support for Starfield's medium plugin type.
Various updates to reflect changes in Starfield's behaviour.
Added a Turkish translation.
Other fixes and improvements.
Support for Fallout 4 from the Epic Games Store.
Better handling of light plugins in Fallout 4 VR and Skyrim VR.
LOOT no longer crashes if masterlist update fails to first update the prelude.
The Flatpak application is now built from source.
Other fixes and improvements.
Fixed error messages displayed for plugins introduced by Skyrim Special Edition v1.6.1130.0.
Fixed error messages not displayed for some types of invalid Fallout 4 plugins.
Fixed errors encountered while parsing game ini files that contain single quote, double quote or backslash characters
Fixed the "Hide Creation Club plugins" filter having no effect.

Disabled sorting for Starfield. Due to the way that Starfield plugins make changes to existing data, LOOT cannot reliable detect when two plugins change the same record, so sorting may not function as intended.

The new plugin type and plugin header flag introduced by Starfield that was previously referred to as the "override" plugin type and flag is now referred to as the "overlay" plugin type and flag for consistency with xEdit, Wrye Bash and Mod Organizer 2.
The "Show only conflicting plugins for" filter has been renamed to "Show only overlapping plugins for" for clarity and consistency with other LOOT functionality.
Added support for Starfield
Fixed potential crashes during game detection and when updating all masterlists
Fixed detection Epic Games Store games installed using Heroic Games Launcher causing LOOT to use the wrong local app data paths for Skyrim Special Edition and Fallout: New Vegas.
Other fixes and improvements

description.p: This is the first release to be made available on Linux.
